thread.title: Man killed, dumped in hallway of Brooklyn apartment building
thread.title_full: Man killed, dumped in hallway of Brooklyn apartment building

author: JOHN ANNESE
title: Man killed, dumped in hallway of Brooklyn apartment building
text:
Queens man, 25, killed and dumped in hallway of Brooklyn apartment building Man killed, dumped in hallway of Brooklyn apartment building 647 Willoughby Avenue in Brooklyn, New York. (Google Maps Street View) NEW YORK DAILY NEWS Tuesday,  08 AM 
Cops are investigating what killed a 25-year-old Queens man dumped in the hallway of a Brooklyn apartment building after he died in one of the apartments Monday morning, police sources said. 
Police found Anthony Toma, 25, dead in the hallway of a building on Willoughby Ave. by Throop Ave. in Bedford-Stuyvesant, after getting a 911 call just before 11 a.m., police sources said. 
Toma, who lived in Ridgewood, died in one of the apartments, and the occupants unceremoniously deposited him outside, sources said. 
Cops found no visible signs of trauma, and the city medical examiner's office will determine his cause of death, police said.
